ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Understanding of the UN and the various mechanisms behind it; how do practical assignments look like (concise briefs), and how does the UN handle pressing matters under high tensions
I learned how to critically evaluate news regarding the UN and its position in the world, which is incredibly valuable in the current political climate.
I learned about the different functions and agencies of the UN

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: Organization, teaching style, concepts and materials 
Weaknesses: Prof. Faieta is a seasoned humanitarian professional whom we are lucky to be in the presence of. I wish the course was structured in a more hand-on way such as activities centering around role-play negotiations, structured meetings, mock sessions. How did the UN really handle these situations and does one begin drafting documents that sometimes hold contentious language for some nations? This course would be more effective if students were able to learn first-hand how the UN works.

Lectures were well structured but felt somewhat dull or repetitive from time to time. Could use student presentations on more open ended topics regarding the UN as a way to breathe more life into the classroom on occasion and keep engagement high.
Could have been more discussion and debates in class. Apart from that the class was comprehensive and very interesting
Very nice grading and extremely chill workload.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! Such a fascinating course that really delves into the intricacies of the UN.
Yes, you get to learn what the structure of the UN, and what it is in the first place.
I think so. Its a very chill class with a low workload and nice grading but don't expect to learn all too much about the UN in detail. The trip to the UN in NYC was fun!
Yes. I thought the material was incredibly interesting, and we were lucky to have such an expert teach us about both the big-picture and the day-to-day operations of such an important organization.

extras.title: GLBL 313 01 - The UN on the Ground
